revisionDesc.change: Proofreading Corrections: Heyde dates and Silent Proof
Review Proofreading Corrections and date note; annotate Moses Lane, Gloucester and Florence, aunt Lib, George's new house; Edward; Jeff Whitman
Clean encoding (editor, date, remove "_large") and add standard annotations on unannotated files (Jeff W, Martha [Mattie], George W, Lou Haslam)
Encode regularization of contractions, days of week, and frequently misspelled words

body.p: i have just receeved received your letter this stormy morning with the dollar in sometimes i want a little change but dont don't send it only once in a while) i have thought walterWalter dear that you must have had more expence expense since you have been sick than you had before but there dont don't seem to be any consideration edds Edd's board is expected just the same

i have got the 2 other letters) you needent needn't direct them to georgeGeorge and the foundry without you would rather as the letter man always brings them georgeGeorge is not there half of the time as he has work for mrMr. Lane at florenceFlorence and glowcesterGloucester he gets his 8 dollars a day from the new york work) there is a large contract from boston Boston given out to the glosterGloucester foundry georgeGeorge thinks he will get the inspecting of it it is about 4 miles from here so you see waltWalt the more we have the more we want) i suppose if i needed georgeGeorge would help me but he has never given me 50 cents since i have been heere here
i dont don't think but what i am welcome here from georgeGeorge Lou sometimes says when she and georgeGeorge was alone they got this and that but now theresthere's so many
a woman can doo do very much to have a man think different from what things really is

georgeGeorge is more changed in some respects than i could ever beleive believe he gives the strectest strictest account of every thing and if he goes out you wont won't be gone more than 10 minutes it seemes seems so strange for him as he always went when he preased pleased and come when he liked) aunt Lib as they call her is here and i gess guess will be here for some tim time Lou says georgeGeorge likes to have her here i like her well enoughf enough i think likely she will make her home here) Lou hasent hasn't been down stairs since last tuesdayTuesday till this morning georgeGeorge carried her down he carries her up and down then she goes out in the kichen kitchen
god forgive me if i judge wrongfully but i dont don't think there is much the matter

dear waltWalt you mustent mustn't think i complain but i think if i had sombodysomebody to talk a little with i should feel releeved relieved so i have to bother you with my gossip good bie walterWalter dear you must write often i was going to write to you to send an envelope for Jeff georges George's house is going on there is a cellar under the whole houshouse and a bay window is Lou s Lou's bed room) and built for 37 hundrd) instead of 38
